t: “Set*ipn the trumpet to your mouth! He*ild shall*i come*i like an eagle against the house of the Lord,*s Because*ld they have transgressed My covenant And*ld rebelled against My law.
Israel*ld will cry to Me, ‘My*ld God, we know You!’
Israel*ld has rejected the good; The*ld enemy will pursue him.
“They*ln set up kings, but not by Me; They*ld made princes, but I did not acknowledge them.*i From*ld their silver and gold They*ld made idols for themselves— That*ld they might be cut off.
Your*ld calf is rejected, O Samaria! My*ld anger is aroused against them— How*ld long until they attain to innocence?
For*ld from Israel is*i even this: A*ld workman made it, and it is*i not God; But*ld the calf of Samaria shall be broken to pieces.
“They*ln sow the wind, And*ld reap the whirlwind. The*ld stalk has no bud; It*ld shall never produce meal. If*ld it should produce, Aliens*ld would swallow it up.
Israel*ld is swallowed up; Now*ld they are among the Gentiles Like*ld a vessel in which is*i no pleasure.
For*ld they have gone up to Assyria, Like*ild a wild donkey alone by itself; Ephraim*ld has hired lovers.
Yes,*ld though they have hired among the nations, Now*ld I will gather them; And*ld they shall sorrow a little, Because*ld of the burden of the king of princes.
“Because*ln Ephraim has made many altars for sin, They*ld have become for him altars for sinning.
I*ld have written for him the great things of My law, But*ild they were considered a strange thing.

For*ild the sacrifices of My offerings they sacrifice flesh and eat it,*i But*ild the Lord*s does not accept them. Now*ld He will remember their iniquity and punish their sins. They*ld shall return to Egypt.
“For*ln Israel has forgotten his Maker, And*ld has built temples; Judah*ld also has multiplied fortified cities; But*ld I will send fire upon his cities, And*ld it shall devour his palaces.”
